material.mattext: Use the drop-down menus to select whether you think each item is a product or not.
All of them are products because products are anything that delivers value to users.

Select the best options to complete the following statement.

In the public sector, any product should .......................... .

Which of the following are the responsibilities of the product manager?

Select all that apply
gather requirements from stakeholders and build them into the product

True or false?

A product team consists of a group of professionals with a variety of expertise or skill set needed to deliver the product.

Select the best option to complete the following statement.

A product vision ................
is a statement that explains why a product exists and what problem it solves.
is a short-term plan for product development
is a marketing strategy for the product
is a method that guides research process in the organization

True or false?

The purpose of product discovery phase is to develop a prototype early in the process.

Select the best option to complete the following sentence.

One way to discover user needs is to .............:
build the product without consulting with the users
assume what users need and then develop the product
Which of the following are examples of user research methods? Select all that apply.

Select the best options to complete the following statement.

Product roadmaps ...........................
Which of the following statements best describes why the product team chooses metrics to evaluate outcomes against objectives?
To ensure that the product meets the needs of the user.
To measure the success of the marketing campaign.
To determine the cost of producing the product.
To evaluate whether the product is achieving its goals and making progress over time.

True or false?

Product planning entails ruthless prioritization of tasks/features based on their  urgency, importance, or necessity to advance work.

True or false?

Usability testing is a technique used to prototype a product.

Select the best options to complete the following statement.

Usability testing is important because it ......... .
gathers feedback directly from users through interviews, focus groups, and surveys
gathers feedback indirectly through various product tracking tools

Select the best option by complete the following statement.

Release plans ................... .

Select the best options by complete the following statement.
Retrospectives .............................
help the team reflect on particular event, practice, or release.
are part of the product evaluation plan
are team rituals to plan the work ahead

What is a user story?

Select the best answer.
A fictional story that describes the product and its features
A narrative that describes how a user interacts with the product
Which of the following statements best describes the difference between leading and lagging product metrics, and why it is important to track both types?

Leading product metrics are backward-looking, while lagging product metrics are forward-looking. It's important to track both types to ensure that a company is meeting its goals and making progress over time.

Leading product metrics are forward-looking, while lagging product metrics are backward-looking. It's important to track both types to understand what actions a company can take to improve future performance.
Leading product metrics are quantitative, while lagging product metrics are qualitative. It's important to track both types to get a complete picture of a company's product performance.
Leading product metrics are user-focused, while lagging product metrics are company-focused. It's important to track both types to balance the needs of the customer with the goals of the company.

What is product value in the context of product management?
Select the best answer.
The product's ability to generate revenue for the business
The perceived benefits that a product offers to its users

What are the high-level phases of the product lifecycle?
Select the three that best describe the phases of the product lifecycle.

What is a prototype, and why is it important in the product development process?
Select the correct answer.
A prototype is the final product design, and it is important because it allows for market testing before launch.
A prototype is a preliminary version of the product, and it is important because it allows for testing and refinement of the design.
A prototype is a product that is ready for launch, and it is important because it allows for early adoption by early adopters.
A prototype is a product that is only used for internal testing, and it is important because it allows for testing and refinement of the design.

Which of the following are reasons why iteration is an important part of the delivery process?

Select all that apply.
Iteration allows for continuous improvement of the product.
Iteration reduces the risk of failure by catching and fixing issues early.
Iteration ensures that the product meets the user needs.
Iteration is not needed after the product is launched.
